DOMAIN_SEPARATOR().details: This value is used for signature validation		by the EIP-712 standard		(https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-712)

params.token: The address of the ERC20 token

returns._0: The balance of the given token

claim(uint256,address,bytes).details: Signature is generated by signing the following message hash:		keccak256(abi.encodePacked(			"\x19\x01",			DOMAIN_SEPARATOR,			keccak256(abi.encode(				DROPLETCLAIM_TYPEHASH,				msg.sender,				amount,				token,				nonce			))		))		Where DOMAIN_SEPARATOR is the EIP-712 domain separator		(https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-712)		and nonce is the number of claims made by the caller		Nonce is used to prevent replay attacks		Signature is generated by signing the message hash		with the private key of the caller		Signature is then split into v, r, and s		which are then passed to this function		Signature is then recovered to the address of the caller		which is then compared to the caller		If the recovered address is not the caller, the claim is reverted

params.amount: The amount of tokens to claim
params.token: The address of the ERC20 token

depositMany(address[],uint256[]).details: This function should be call by owner but opens for donation		and reverts if the length of the two arrays are not equal		or if any of the depositToken() calls reverts

params.amounts: The amounts of tokens to deposit
params.tokens: The addresses of the ERC20 tokens

depositManySig(address[],uint256[],bytes.details: This function should be call by owner but opens for donation		and reverts if the length of the three arrays are not equal		or if any of the depositTokenSig() calls reverts

params.amounts: The amounts of tokens to deposit
params.tokens: The addresses of the ERC20 tokens

depositToken(address,uint256).details: This function should be call by owner but opens for donation

params.amount: The amount of tokens to deposit
params.token: The address of the ERC20 token

depositTokenSig(address,uint256,bytes,ui.details: This function should be call by owner but opens for donation		and reverts if the token is not registered		or if the permit is invalid

params.amount: The amount of tokens to deposit
params.token: The address of the ERC20 token

nonces(address).details: Returns the next unused nonce for an address.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdrawAll().details: This function is only callable by the owner

withdrawToken(address,uint256,bool).details: This function is only callable by the owner

params.all: If true, withdraws all amount of the given type
params.amount: The amount of tokens to withdraw
params.token: The address of the ERC20 token

balanceOf(address).notice: Returns the balance of the given token

balanceOfAll().notice: Returns the balance of all tokens

claim(uint256,address,bytes).notice: Claims ERC20 tokens from the contract

depositMany(address[],uint256[]).notice: Deposits ERC20 tokens into the contract	by calling depositToken() multiple times

depositManySig(address[],uint256[],bytes.notice: Deposits ERC20 tokens into the contract with permit	by calling depositTokenSig() multiple times

depositToken(address,uint256).notice: Deposits ERC20 tokens into the contract

depositTokenSig(address,uint256,bytes,ui.notice: Deposits ERC20 tokens into the contract with permit

withdrawAll().notice: Withdraws all ERC20 tokens from the contract

withdrawToken(address,uint256,bool).notice: Withdraws ERC20 tokens from the contract

documentation.text:
@notice Claims ERC20 tokens from the contract
 @param amount The amount of tokens to claim
 @param token The address of the ERC20 token
 @param signature The signature of the claim
 @dev Signature is generated by signing the following message hash:
		keccak256(abi.encodePacked(
			"\x19\x01",
			DOMAIN_SEPARATOR,
			keccak256(abi.encode(
				DROPLETCLAIM_TYPEHASH,
				msg.sender,
				amount,
				token,
				nonce
			))
		))
		Where DOMAIN_SEPARATOR is the EIP-712 domain separator
		(https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-712)
		and nonce is the number of claims made by the caller
		Nonce is used to prevent replay attacks
		Signature is generated by signing the message hash
		with the private key of the caller
		Signature is then split into v, r, and s
		which are then passed to this function
		Signature is then recovered to the address of the caller
		which is then compared to the caller
		If the recovered address is not the caller, the claim is reverted

typeDescriptions.typeString: function () view returns (struct DropletClaim.Balance memory[] memory)

documentation.text:
@notice Withdraws all ERC20 tokens from the contract
 @dev This function is only callable by the owner

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) pure returns (struct DropletClaim.Balance memory[] memory)

documentation.text:
@notice Returns the balance of all tokens
 @return The balance of all tokens
